message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.IR, cs.LG

This paper focuses on developing a methodology for community detection based on semantic relations between textual features of user-generated content. This falls under the sub-category of natural language processing (NLP), which is covered by cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper uses neural representation of published contents of users, which falls under the sub-category of machine learning, specifically deep learning, covered by cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

The paper also deals with identifying nuanced discussion topics, which involves information retrieval (IR) techniques, covered by cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The methodology developed in the paper involves optimizing the finding of dense groups of users as communities, which falls under the sub-category of social and information networks, covered by cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing). 

Overall, the most likely sub-category for this paper is cs.CL, followed by cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.IR, and cs.LG.
